change_country(ap_serial, country)¶

Sets the country code of a AP to selected one. In case of SKU incompatibility, following is an example error we get The region code AH-13ad80 is set for “world”, and cannot be changed on an FCC coded device.

Parameters

  • ap_serial – AP Serial Number

  • country – Country Code

Returns

1 in case of success else -1

Parameters

  • ap_name – Ap name Ex: AP1130

  • ap_mac – Ap mac Ex: F09CE9F89600

Returns

get_ap_row(ap_serial='default', ap_name='default', ap_mac='default')¶

This keyword returns the row of matched AP

Parameters

  • ap_serial – AP Serial

  • ap_name – AP Name

  • ap_mac – AP MAC

Returns

returns the row object

get_ap_status(ap_serial='default', ap_name='default', ap_mac='default')¶

This keyword returns the AP’s status by searching AP using serial, name or mac address

Parameters

  • ap_serial – AP Serial

  • ap_name – AP Name

  • ap_mac – AP MAC

Returns

‘green’ if the AP is online else return -1

get_device_status(device_serial='default', device_name='default', device_mac='default')¶

This keyword returns the device’s status by searching device using serial, name or mac address :param device_serial: device Serial :param device_name: device Name :param device_mac: device MAC :return: ‘green’ if the device is online else return -1

get_manage_device_row(search_string)¶

Get the device rows from the manage device page

:param search_string it should be anything which is searched on the row cell

example search_string be like device_name, Device Model, Mac Address or Serial number

Returns

row element if row exists else return None

update_network_policy_to_ap(policy_name=None, ap_serial=None, update_method='Delta')¶

Go To MANAGE–>Devices–>Select AP row to apply the network policy 1. Actions–>Assign Network Policy –>Select the network policy to assign 2. select AP–>Update device

Parameters

  • policy_name – name of the network to deploy

  • ap_serial – serial number of the ap to select

  • update_method – Perform Complete update or delta update

Returns

upgrade_device_to_latest_version(device_serial, version=None)¶

This method update device(s) to latest version from the dropdown

Parameters

  • device_serial – serial number(s) of the device(s)

  • version – version to which device(s) should get upgraded

Returns

1 if success

  • version – version to which device(s) should get upgraded

verify_ap_status(ap_serial='default', ap_name='default', ap_mac='default', status='default')¶

This keyword returns 1 if AP status expected matches the status passed as argument

Parameters

  • ap_serial – AP Serial

  • ap_name – AP Name

  • ap_mac – AP MAC

  • status – green, red, or amber as of now - may change in future

Returns

verify_device_status(device_serial='default', device_name='default', device_mac='default', status='default')¶

This keyword returns 1 if device status expected matches the status passed as argument

Parameters

  • device_serial – device Serial

  • device_name – device Name

  • device_mac – device MAC

  • status – green, red, or amber as of now - may change in future

Returns

create_open_auth_express_network_policy(policy_name, ssid_name, cwp=None)¶

This method navigates to Network Policies page Searches whether policy exists. Returns 1 if already exists. Else it creates a Network Policy using Express Policy Setup By default this creates network policy by disabling CWP

Parameters

  • policy_name – Policy Name

  • ssid_name – SSID name

  • cwp – Captive Portal

Returns
